free_text.Prerequisite for: Semester projects and master, professional occupation, PhD thesis[br/]
free_text.Content: What is the planning of experiments, what are its objectives and when to apply it ?[br/][li]Significance of an experimental result: is it reproducible ? When are we sure that two results are different ? [br/][li]What happens when taking a sample ? Sampling methods.[br/][li]Simple experiments for comparing two materials or treatments.[br/][li]How to test several variables without excessive multiplication of the number of tests ?[br/][li]Design of experiments allowing to analyze several experimental factors simultaneously. Execution of an experimental design in several blocs. Analysis of the results. What to do in case of missing results ?[br/][li]Economical experimental designs for the simultaneous analysis of a large number of factors. [br/][li]Operational and noise factors. How to select an experimental field where the effect of noise factors is negligible ? The "Taguchi" methodology.[br/][li]Adjustment of experimental results to a hypothetical model: up to which point does the model explain the observations ?[br/][li]In a well defined experimental field, how to find rapidly the optimum ?[br/][br/][br/]
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra and exercises integrated ino the courses, Excel® numerical exercises
free_text.Learning outcomes: At the end of this course, the student shall be able to conceive and organize an experimental program aiming at reaching efficiently preset objectives for the optimization of a material and/or a manufacturing process, while complying with available time and resources. The course shall develop optimal methods for exploiting the information resulting from the execution of experimental programs.[br/]
